msItem.title: Masir-i Talibi fi bilad-i Ifranji..
msItem.note: F1a: Signature of Ellis, dated 27/8.09. Final folio of text, verso, in Ellis's hand: Luzan (Campbell) Second folio after text, verso: The honble A. Seton Esquire. An account of the author's journey to Europe and his observations. Written on the instructions of Nawwab Abu 'l-Qasim Khan. Headings and punctuation in red.
msItem.incipit: Ba'd-i hamd-i khudawand-i 'alam kih bakhshandah-i humam

listBibl.bibl: The same work as Codrington/Reade No 177.

bindingDesc.p: Brown leather blind-tooled binding, the covers and spine loose. Needs conservation.

origin.p: A.H. 19 Sha'ban 1220. (Slightly earlier than any in Storey.)

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org
